sections.MISSION:
Bull Troop conducts M4/M249 qualification training at Range 1262 NLT 26APR24 IOT qualify Soldiers on individual weapons systems.
Leader’s
sections.PURPOSE: Ensure Bull Troop SMs are fundamentally sound on all levels on marksmanship IOT prepare for upcoming training events and maintain lethality within Bull Troop.

Zero all M4/M249s
Engage Targets with an M4/M249 Qualify all shooters on M4/M249 IAW TC 3-22.4
Correct Malfunctions of an M4/M249
Target Transitions/ Movement
Ammo Belt Changes
sections.END STATE:
/Training Outcomes:
All Soldiers are safely Qualified on M4/M249.
Concept of the Operation: All will draw their respective weapons systems at their Troops.
SMs will link-up at the Troop AO for transportation to Range 124/126.
SMs will SP to Range 124/126.
Range set- up tutorial, OIC & RSO brief
SMs will begin training once range is live and ammo has been dropped off.
SMs will conduct M4/M249 qualification at Range 124/126 IAW TC 3-22.40.
Safety: All Soldiers will validate a zeroed weapon before the qualification
1x lane safety will be present for each 2x Soldiers on the range

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are certified and trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two ten (10) pound fire extinguishers on hand at ammo point.
Separate live/spent by placement on separate pads
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after execution to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified by QASAS.

values: Soldiers will adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA. Speed will be reduced during hours of limited visibility
Speed limit is based on the following: Road Conditions, Vehicle Type and Visibility.
Normal Driving Conditions:
On paved portions of the main tank trails: 60 KPH (36 MPH).
On gravel portions of the main tank trails: 50 KPH (30 MPH).
Range roads: 30 KPH (18 MPH).
When passing troops: 16 KPH (10 MPH).
Maximum of 5mph if operating within 8 meters of dismounted troops or with a ground guide.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
All Soldiers inside of a tactical vehicle will either be seated in a designated seating platform with a seatbelt, or standing with a restraint harness.
Soldiers will be no higher than name-tape defilade if standing/outside of vehicle while it is moving.
Leaders deliver a convoy brief IAW TACSOP and understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
Soldiers will sleep only in designated areas IAW War Eagle SOP.
All vehicles will have licensed drivers, certified to drive at night, posess a valid 5988 and dispatch

draw.overall_supervision_plan: OIC and RSO will orient soldiers to the range and conduct a safety brief. Soldiers will coach/safety each other on the firing line with NCO's safetying in a 1:1 ratio. OIC and RSO will continuously monitor all aspects of the Qualification. Newly Identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be improved at the appropriate level. Every Soldier will be considered a safety, if they see an unsafe act they will call a cease fire and notify everyone to stop training.
